text: Neither do men light a candle , and put it under a bushel , but on a candlestick ; and it giveth light unto all that are in the house .
text2: ak ana lukarnastaþin jah liuteiþ allaim þaim in þamma garda

text: Let your light so shine before men , that they may see your good works , and glorify your Father which is in heaven .
text2: swa liuhtjai liuhaþ izwar in andwairþja manne ei gasaiƕaina izwara goda waurstwa jah hauhjaina attan izwarana þana in himinam

text: Think not that I am come to destroy the law , or the prophets : I am not come to destroy , but to fulfil .
text2: ni hugjaiþ ei qemjau gatairan witoþ aiþþau praufetuns ni qam gatairan ak usfulljan

text: For verily I say unto you , Till heaven and earth pass , one jot or one tittle shall in no wise pass from the law , till all be fulfilled .

text: Whosoever therefore shall break one of these least commandments , and shall teach men so , he shall be called the least in the kingdom of heaven : but whosoever shall do and teach them , the same shall be called great in the kingdom of heaven .
text2: iþ saei nu gatairiþ aina anabusne þizo minnistono jah laisjai swa mans minnista haitada in þiudangardjai himine iþ saei taujiþ jah laisjai swa sah mikils haitada in þiudangardjai himine

text: For I say unto you , That except your righteousness shall exceed the righteousness of the scribes and Pharisees , ye shall in no case enter into the kingdom of heaven .
text2: qiþa auk izwis þatei nibai managizo wairþiþ izwaraizos garaihteins þau þize bokarje jah Fareisaie ni þau qimiþ in þiudangardjai himine

text: Ye have heard that it was said by them of old time , Thou shalt not kill ; and whosoever shall kill shall be in danger of the judgment :
text2: hausideduþ þatei qiþan ist þaim airizam ni maurþrjais iþ saei maurþreiþ skula wairþiþ stauai

text: But I say unto you , That whosoever is angry with his brother without a cause shall be in danger of the judgment : and whosoever shall say to his brother , Raca , shall be in danger of the council : but whosoever shall say , Thou fool , shall be in danger of hell fire .
text2: aþþan ik qiþa izwis þatei ƕazuh modags broþr seinamma sware skula wairþiþ stauai iþ saei qiþiþ broþr seinamma raka skula wairþiþ gaqumþai aþþan saei qiþiþ dwala skula wairþiþ in gaiainnan funins

text: Therefore if thou bring thy gift to the altar , and there rememberest that thy brother hath ought against thee ;
text2: jabai nu bairais aibr þein du hunslastada jah jainar gamuneis þatei broþar þeins habaiþ ƕa bi þuk

text: Leave there thy gift before the altar , and go thy way ; first be reconciled to thy brother , and then come and offer thy gift .
text2: aflet jainar þo giba þeina in andwairþja hunslastadis jah gagg faurþis gasibjon broþr þeinamma jah biþe atgaggands atbair þo giba þeina

text: Agree with thine adversary quickly , whiles thou art in the way with him ; lest at any time the adversary deliver thee to the judge , and the judge deliver thee to the officer , and thou be cast into prison .
text2: sijais waila hugjands andastauin þeinamma sprauto und þatei is in wiga miþ imma ibai ƕan atgibai þuk sa andastaua stauin jah sa staua þuk atgibai andbahta jah in karkara galagjaza

text: Verily I say unto thee , Thou shalt by no means come out thence , till thou hast paid the uttermost farthing .
text2: amen qiþa þus ni usgaggis jainþro unte usgibis þana minnistan kintu

text: Ye have heard that it was said by them of old time , Thou shalt not commit adultery :
text2: hausideduþ þatei qiþan ist ni horinos

text: But I say unto you , That whosoever looketh on a woman to lust after her hath committed adultery with her already in his heart .
text2: aþþan ik qiþa izwis þatei ƕazuh saei saiƕiþ qinon du luston izos ju gahorinoda izai in hairtin seinamma

text: And if thy right eye offend thee , pluck it out , and cast it from thee : for it is profitable for thee that one of thy members should perish , and not that thy whole body should be cast into hell .
text2: iþ jabai augo þein þata taihswo marzjai þuk usstagg ita jah wairp af þus batizo ist auk þus ei fraqistnai ains liþiwe þeinaize jah ni allata leik þein gadriusai in gaiainnan

text: And if thy right hand offend thee , cut if off , and cast it from thee : for it is profitable for thee that one of thy members should perish , and not that thy whole body should be cast into hell .
text2: jah jabai taihswo þeina handus marzjai þuk afmait þo jah wairp af þus batizo ist auk þus ei fraqistnai ains liþiwe þeinaize jah ni allata leik þein gadriusai in gaiainnan

text: It hath been said , Whosoever shall put away his wife , let him give her a writing of divorcement :
text2: qiþan uh þan ist þatei ƕazuh saei afletai qen gibai izai afstassais bokos

text: But I say unto you , That whosoever shall put away his wife , saving for the cause of fornication , causeth her to commit adultery : and whosoever shall marry her that is divorced committeth adultery .
text2: iþ ik qiþa izwis þatei ƕazuh saei afletiþ qen seina inuh fairina kalkinassaus taujiþ þo horinon jah sa ize afsatida liugaiþ horinoþ

text: Again , ye have heard that it hath been said by them of old time , Thou shalt not forswear thyself , but shalt perform unto the Lord thine oaths :
text2: aftra hausideduþ þatei qiþan ist þaim airizam ni ufarswarais iþ usgibais fraujin aiþans þeinans

text: But I say unto you , Swear not at all ; neither by heaven ; for it is God ' s throne :
text2: aþþan ik qiþa izwis ni swaran allis ni bi himina unte stols ist gudis

text: Nor by the earth ; for it is his footstool : neither by Jerusalem ; for it is the city of the great King .
text2: nih bi airþai unte fotubaurd ist fotiwe is nih bi Iairusaulwmai unte baurgs ist þis mikilins þiudanis

text: Neither shalt thou swear by thy head , because thou canst not make one hair white or black .
text2: nih bi haubida þeinamma swarais unte ni magt ain tagl ƕeit aiþþau swart gataujan

text: But let your communication be , Yea , yea ; Nay , nay : for whatsoever is more than these cometh of evil .

text: Ye have heard that it hath been said , An eye for an eye , and a tooth for a tooth :
text2: hausideduþ þatei qiþan ist augo und augin jah tunþu und tunþau

text: But I say unto you , That ye resist not evil : but whosoever shall smite thee on thy right cheek , turn to him the other also .

text: And if any man will sue thee at the law , and take away thy coat , let him have thy cloke also .
text2: jah þamma wiljandin miþ þus staua jah paida þeina niman aflet imma jah wastja

text: And whosoever shall compel thee to go a mile , go with him twain .
text2: jah jabai ƕas þuk ananauþjai rasta aina gaggais miþ imma twos

text: Give to him that asketh thee , and from him that would borrow of thee turn not thou away .
text2: þamma bidjandin þuk gibais jah þamma wiljandin af þus leiƕan sis ni uswandjais

text: Ye have heard that it hath been said , Thou shalt love thy neighbour , and hate thine enemy .
text2: hausideduþ þatei qiþan ist frijos neƕundjan þeinana jah fiais fiand þeinana

text: But I say unto you , Love your enemies , bless them that curse you , do good to them that hate you , and pray for them which despitefully use you , and persecute you ;
text2: aþþan ik qiþa izwis frijoþ fijands izwarans þiuþjaiþ þans wrikandans izwis waila taujaiþ þaim hatjandam izwis jah bidjaiþ bi þans usþriutandans izwis

text: That ye may be the children of your Father which is in heaven : for he maketh his sun to rise on the evil and on the good , and sendeth rain on the just and on the unjust .
text2: ei wairþaiþ sunjus attins izwaris þis in himinam unte sunnon seina urranneiþ ana ubilans jah godans jah rigneiþ ana garaihtans jah ana inwindans

text: For if ye love them which love you , what reward have ye ? do not even the publicans the same ?

text: And if ye salute your brethren only , what do ye more than others ? do not even the publicans so ?
text2: jah jabai goleiþ þans frijonds izwarans þatainei ƕe managizo taujiþ niu jah motarjos þata samo taujand

text: Be ye therefore perfect , even as your Father which is in heaven is perfect .
text2: sijaiþ nu jus fullatojai swaswe atta izwar sa in himinam fullatojis ist

text: Take heed that ye do not your alms before men , to be seen of them : otherwise ye have no reward of your Father which is in heaven .
text2: Atsaiƕiþ armaion izwara ni taujan in andwairþja manne du saiƕan im aiþþau laun ni habaiþ fram attin izwaramma þamma in himinam

text: Therefore when thou doest thine alms , do not sound a trumpet before thee , as the hypocrites do in the synagogues and in the streets , that they may have glory of men . Verily I say unto you , They have their reward .
text2: þan nu taujais armaion ni haurnjais faura þus swaswe þai liutans taujand in gaqumþim jah in garunsim ei hauhjaindau fram mannam amen qiþa izwis andnemun mizdon seina

text: But when thou doest alms , let not thy left hand know what thy right hand doeth :
text2: iþ þuk taujandan armaion ni witi hleidumei þeina ƕa taujiþ taihswo þeina

text: That thine alms may be in secret : and thy Father which seeth in secret himself shall reward thee openly .
text2: ei sijai so armahairtiþa þeina in fulhsnja jah atta þeins saei saiƕiþ in fulhsnja usgibiþ þus in bairhtein

text: And when thou prayest , thou shalt not be as the hypocrites are : for they love to pray standing in the synagogues and in the corners of the streets , that they may be seen of men . Verily I say unto you , They have their reward .
text2: jah þan bidjaiþ ni sijaiþ swaswe þai liutans unte frijond in gaqumþim jah waihstam plapjo standandans bidjan ei gaumjaindau mannam Amen qiþa izwis þatei haband mizdon seina

text: But thou , when thou prayest , enter into thy closet , and when thou hast shut thy door , pray to thy Father which is in secret ; and thy Father which seeth in secret shall reward thee openly .
text2: iþ þu þan bidjais gagg in heþjon þeina jah galukands haurdai þeinai bidei du attin þeinamma þamma in fulhsnja jah atta þeins saei saiƕiþ in fulhsnja usgibiþ þus in bairhtein

text: But when ye pray , use not vain repetitions , as the heathen do : for they think that they shall be heard for their much speaking .
text2: bidjandans uþ þan ni filuwaurdjaiþ swaswe þai þiudo þugkeiþ im auk ei in filuwaurdein seinai andhausjaindau

text: Be not ye therefore like unto them : for your Father knoweth what things ye have need of , before ye ask him .

text: After this manner therefore pray ye : Our Father which art in heaven , Hallowed be thy name .

text: Thy kingdom come . Thy will be done in earth , as it is in heaven .

text: Give us this day our daily bread .
text2: hlaif unsarana þana sinteinan gif uns himma daga

text: And forgive us our debts , as we forgive our debtors .
text2: jah aflet uns þatei skulans sijaima swaswe jah weis afletam þaim skulam unsaraim

text: And lead us not into temptation , but deliver us from evil : For thine is the kingdom , and the power , and the glory , for ever . Amen .

text: For if ye forgive men their trespasses , your heavenly Father will also forgive you :

text: But if ye forgive not men their trespasses , neither will your Father forgive your trespasses .

text: Moreover when ye fast , be not , as the hypocrites , of a sad countenance : for they disfigure their faces , that they may appear unto men to fast . Verily I say unto you , They have their reward .
text2: aþþan biþe fastaiþ ni wairþaiþ swaswe þai liutans gaurai frawardjand auk andwairþja seina ei gasaiƕaindau mannam fastandans amen qiþa izwis þatei andnemun mizdon seina

text: But thou , when thou fastest , anoint thine head , and wash thy face ;

text: That thou appear not unto men to fast , but unto thy Father which is in secret : and thy Father , which seeth in secret , shall reward thee openly .
text2: ei ni gasaiƕaizau mannam fastands ak attin þeinamma þamma in fulhsnja jah atta þeins saei saiƕiþ in fulhsnja usgibiþ þus

text: Lay not up for yourselves treasures upon earth , where moth and rust doth corrupt , and where thieves break through and steal :
text2: ni huzdjaiþ izwis huzda ana airþai þarei malo jah nidwa frawardeiþ jah þarei þiubos ufgraband jah hlifand

text: But lay up for yourselves treasures in heaven , where neither moth nor rust doth corrupt , and where thieves do not break through nor steal :
text2: iþ huzdjaiþ izwis huzda in himina þarei nih malo nih nidwa frawardeiþ jah þarei þiubos ni ufgraband nih stiland

text: For where your treasure is , there will your heart be also .

text: The light of the body is the eye : if therefore thine eye be single , thy whole body shall be full of light .
text2: lukarn leikis ist augo jabai nu augo þein ainfalþ ist allata leik þein liuhadein wairþiþ

text: But if thine eye be evil , thy whole body shall be full of darkness . If therefore the light that is in thee be darkness , how great is that darkness !

text: No man can serve two masters : for either he will hate the one , and love the other ; or else he will hold to the one , and despise the other . Ye cannot serve God and mammon .

text: Therefore I say unto you , Take no thought for your life , what ye shall eat , or what ye shall drink ; nor yet for your body , what ye shall put on . Is not the life more than meat , and the body than raiment ?
text2: Duþþe qiþa izwis ni maurnaiþ saiwalai izwarai ƕa matjaiþ jah ƕa drigkaiþ nih leika izwaramma ƕe wasjaiþ niu saiwala mais ist fodeinai jah leik wastjom

text: Behold the fowls of the air : for they sow not , neither do they reap , nor gather into barns ; yet your heavenly Father feedeth them . Are ye not much better than they ?

text: Which of you by taking thought can add one cubit unto his stature ?
text2: iþ ƕas izwara maurnands mag anaaukan ana wahstu seinana aleina aina

text: And why take ye thought for raiment ? Consider the lilies of the field , how they grow ; they toil not , neither do they spin :

text: And yet I say unto you , That even Solomon in all his glory was not arrayed like one of these .

text: Wherefore , if God so clothe the grass of the field , which to day is , and to morrow is cast into the oven , shall he not much more clothe you , O ye of little faith ?
text2: jah þande þata hawi haiþjos himma daga wisando jah gistradagis in auhn galagiþ guþ swa wasjiþ ƕaiwa mais izwis leitil galaubjandans

text: Therefore take no thought , saying , What shall we eat ? or , What shall we drink ? or , Wherewithal shall we be clothed ?
text2: ni maurnaiþ nu qiþandans ƕa matjam aiþþau ƕa drigkam aiþþau ƕe wasjaima

text: ( For after all these things do the Gentiles seek : ) for your heavenly Father knoweth that ye have need of all these things .
text2: all auk þata þiudos sokjand wait uh þan atta izwar sa ufar himinam þatei þaurbuþ

text: Therefore all things whatsoever ye would that men should do to you , do ye even so to them : for this is the law and the prophets .

text: Enter ye in at the strait gate : for wide is the gate , and broad is the way , that leadeth to destruction , and many there be which go in thereat :

text: Because strait is the gate , and narrow is the way , which leadeth unto life , and few there be that find it .
text2: ƕan aggwu þata daur jah þraihans wigs sa brigganda in libainai jah fawai sind þai bigitandans þana

text: Beware of false prophets , which come to you in sheep ' s clothing , but inwardly they are ravening wolves .

text: Ye shall know them by their fruits . Do men gather grapes of thorns , or figs of thistles ?

text: Even so every good tree bringeth forth good fruit ; but a corrupt tree bringeth forth evil fruit .
text2: swa all bagme godaize akrana goda gataujiþ iþ sa ubila bagms akrana ubila gataujiþ

text: A good tree cannot bring forth evil fruit , neither can a corrupt tree bring forth good fruit .
text2: ni mag bagms þiuþeigs akrana ubila gataujan nih bagms ubils akrana þiuþeiga gataujan

text: Every tree that bringeth not forth good fruit is hewn down , and cast into the fire .

text: Wherefore by their fruits ye shall know them .

text: Many will say to me in that day , Lord , Lord , have we not prophesied in thy name ? and in thy name have cast out devils ? and in thy name done many wonderful works ?

text: And then will I profess unto them , I never knew you : depart from me , ye that work iniquity .
text2: jah þan andhaita im þatei ni ƕanhun kunþa izwis afleiþiþ fairra mis jus waurkjandans unsibjona

text: Therefore whosoever heareth these sayings of mine , and doeth them , I will liken him unto a wise man , which built his house upon a rock :
text2: ƕazuh nu saei hauseiþ waurda meina jah taujiþ þo galeiko ina waira frodamma saei gatimrida razn sein ana staina

text: And the rain descended , and the floods came , and the winds blew , and beat upon that house ; and it fell not : for it was founded upon a rock .

text: And every one that heareth these sayings of mine , and doeth them not , shall be likened unto a foolish man , which built his house upon the sand :
text2: jah ƕazuh saei hauseiþ waurda meina jah ni taujiþ þo galeikoda mann dwalamma saei gatimrida razn sein ana malmin

text: And the rain descended , and the floods came , and the winds blew , and beat upon that house ; and it fell : and great was the fall of it .

text: And it came to pass , when Jesus had ended these sayings , the people were astonished at his doctrine :

text: For he taught them as one having authority , and not as the scribes .

text: And when Jesus was entered into Capernaum , there came unto him a centurion , beseeching him ,

text: And he said unto them , Unto you it is given to know the mystery of the kingdom of God : but unto them that are without , all these things are done in parables :

text: The sower soweth the word .

text: And these are they by the way side , where the word is sown ; but when they have heard , Satan cometh immediately , and taketh away the word that was sown in their hearts .

text: And they asked them , saying , Is this your son , who ye say was born blind ? how then doth he now see ?

text: His parents answered them and said , We know that this is our son , and that he was born blind :

text: Then again called they the man that was blind , and said unto him , Give God the praise : we know that this man is a sinner .

text: He answered and said , Whether he be a sinner or no , I know not : one thing I know , that , whereas I was blind , now I see .

text: Then said they to him again , What did he to thee ? how opened he thine eyes ?

text: Then they reviled him , and said , Thou art his disciple ; but we are Moses ' disciples .

text: We know that God spake unto Moses : as for this fellow , we know not from whence he is .

text: The man answered and said unto them , Why herein is a marvellous thing , that ye know not from whence he is , and yet he hath opened mine eyes .

text: Now we know that God heareth not sinners : but if any man be a worshipper of God , and doeth his will , him he heareth .

text: Yet a little while , and the world seeth me no more ; but ye see me : because I live , ye shall live also .

text: He that hath my commandments , and keepeth them , he it is that loveth me : and he that loveth me shall be loved of my Father , and I will love him , and will manifest myself to him .

text2: þata rodida izwis at izwis wisands

text: Neither pray I for these alone , but for them also which shall believe on me through their word ;

text: That they all may be one ; as thou , Father , art in me , and I in thee , that they also may be one in us : that the world may believe that thou hast sent me .

text: And the glory which thou gavest me I have given them ; that they may be one , even as we are one :

text: I in them , and thou in me , that they may be made perfect in one ; and that the world may know that thou hast sent me , and hast loved them , as thou hast loved me .

text: Father , I will that they also , whom thou hast given me , be with me where I am ; that they may behold my glory , which thou hast given me : for thou lovedst me before the foundation of the world .

text: When Jesus had spoken these words , he went forth with his disciples over the brook Cedron , where was a garden , into the which he entered , and his disciples .

text: Jesus therefore , knowing all things that should come upon him , went forth , and said unto them , Whom seek ye ?

text2: andhafjandans imma qeþun Iesu þana Nazoraiu þaruh qaþ im Iesus ik im stoþ uh þan jah Iudas sa lewjands ina miþ im

text: As soon then as he had said unto them , I am he , they went backward , and fell to the ground .

text: Then asked he them again , Whom seek ye ? And they said , Jesus of Nazareth .

text: That the saying might be fulfilled , which he spake , Of them which thou gavest me have I lost none .

text: Then Simon Peter having a sword drew it , and smote the high priest ' s servant , and cut off his right ear . The servant ' s name was Malchus .

text: And led him away to Annas first ; for he was father in law to Caiaphas , which was the high priest that same year .

text: And Simon Peter followed Jesus , and so did another disciple : that disciple was known unto the high priest , and went in with Jesus into the palace of the high priest .

text: Then saith the damsel that kept the door unto Peter , Art not thou also one of this man ' s disciples ? He saith , I am not .

text: And the servants and officers stood there , who had made a fire of coals ; for it was cold : and they warmed themselves : and Peter stood with them , and warmed himself .

text: The high priest then asked Jesus of his disciples , and of his doctrine .

text: Why askest thou me ? ask them which heard me , what I have said unto them : behold , they know what I said .

text: One of the servants of the high priest , being his kinsman whose ear Peter cut off , saith , Did not I see thee in the garden with him ?

text: Pilate then went out unto them , and said , What accusation bring ye against this man ?

text: They answered and said unto him , If he were not a malefactor , we would not have delivered him up unto thee .

text: Then said Pilate unto them , Take ye him , and judge him according to your law . The Jews therefore said unto him , It is not lawful for us to put any man to death :

text: That the saying of Jesus might be fulfilled , which he spake , signifying what death he should die .

text: Then Pilate entered into the judgment hall again , and called Jesus , and said unto him , Art thou the King of the Jews ?

text: Jesus answered him , Sayest thou this thing of thyself , or did others tell it thee of me ?

text: Pilate answered , Am I a Jew ? Thine own nation and the chief priests have delivered thee unto me : what hast thou done ?

text: Jesus answered , My kingdom is not of this world : if my kingdom were of this world , then would my servants fight , that I should not be delivered to the Jews : but now is my kingdom not from hence .

text: Pilate therefore said unto him , Art thou a king then ? Jesus answered , Thou sayest that I am a king . To this end was I born , and for this cause came I into the world , that I should bear witness unto the truth . Every one that is of the truth heareth my voice .
text2: þaruh qaþ imma Peilatus an nuh þiudans is þu andhafjands Iesus qaþ þu qiþis ei þiudans im ik ik du þamma gabaurans im jah du þamma qam in þamma fairƕau ei weitwodjau sunjai ƕazuh saei ist sunjos hauseiþ stibnos meinaizos

text: Pilate saith unto him , What is truth ? And when he had said this , he went out again unto the Jews , and saith unto them , I find in him no fault at all .

text: But ye have a custom , that I should release unto you one at the passover : will ye therefore that I release unto you the King of the Jews ?

text: Then cried they all again , saying , Not this man , but Barabbas . Now Barabbas was a robber .

text: Then Pilate therefore took Jesus , and scourged him .
text2: þanuh þan nam Peilatus Iesu jah usblaggw

text: And the soldiers platted a crown of thorns , and put it on his head , and they put on him a purple robe ,

text: And said , Hail , King of the Jews ! and they smote him with their hands .

text: Pilate therefore went forth again , and saith unto them , Behold , I bring him forth to you , that ye may know that I find no fault in him .

text: Then came Jesus forth , wearing the crown of thorns , and the purple robe . And Pilate saith unto them , Behold the man !

text: When the chief priests therefore and officers saw him , they cried out , saying , Crucify him , crucify him . Pilate saith unto them , Take ye him , and crucify him : for I find no fault in him .

text: The Jews answered him , We have a law , and by our law he ought to die , because he made himself the Son of God .

text: When Pilate therefore heard that saying , he was the more afraid ;

text: And went again into the judgment hall , and saith unto Jesus , Whence art thou ? But Jesus gave him no answer .

text: Then saith Pilate unto him , Speakest thou not unto me ? knowest thou not that I have power to crucify thee , and have power to release thee ?
text2: þaruh qaþ imma Peilatus du mis ni rodeis niu waist þatei waldufni aih ushramjan þuk jah waldufni aih fraletan þuk

text: Jesus answered , Thou couldest have no power at all against me , except it were given thee from above : therefore he that delivered me unto thee hath the greater sin .
text2: andhof Iesus ni aihtedeis waldufnje ainhun ana mik nih wesi þus atgiban iupaþro duhþe sa galewjands mik þus maizein frawaurht habaid

text: And from thenceforth Pilate sought to release him : but the Jews cried out , saying , If thou let this man go , thou art not Caesar ' s friend : whosoever maketh himself a king speaketh against Caesar .
text2: fram uh þamma sokida Peilatus fraletan ina iþ Iudaieis hropidedun qiþandans jabai þana fraletis ni is frijonds kaisara saƕazuh izei þiudan sik silban taujiþ andstandiþ kaisara

text: When Pilate therefore heard that saying , he brought Jesus forth , and sat down in the judgment seat in a place that is called the Pavement , but in the Hebrew , Gabbatha .
text2: þanuh Peilatus hausjands þize

text: For the wages of sin is death ; but the gift of God is eternal life through Jesus Christ our Lord .
text2: þo auk launa frawaurhtais dauþus iþ ansts gudis libains aiweino in Xristau Iesu fraujin unsaramma

text: Know ye not , brethren , ( for I speak to them that know the law , ) how that the law hath dominion over a man as long as he liveth ?
text2: þau niu wituþ broþrjus kunnandam auk witoþ rodja þatei witoþ fraujinoþ mann swa lagga ƕeila swe libaiþ

text: For the woman which hath an husband is bound by the law to her husband so long as he liveth ; but if the husband be dead , she is loosed from the law of her husband .
text2: jah auk ufwaira qens at libandin abin gabundana ist witoda aþþan jabai gaswiltiþ aba galausjada af þamma witoda abins

text: So then if , while her husband liveth , she be married to another man , she shall be called an adulteress : but if her husband be dead , she is free from that law ; so that she is no adulteress , though she be married to another man .
text2: þannu þan at libandin abin haitada horinondei jabai wairþiþ waira anþaramma iþ jabai gaswiltiþ wair frija ist þis witodis ei ni sijai horinondei waurþana abin anþaramma

text: Wherefore , my brethren , ye also are become dead to the law by the body of Christ ; that ye should be married to another , even to him who is raised from the dead , that we should bring forth fruit unto God .
text2: swaei nu jah jus broþrjus meinai afdauþidai waurþuþ witoda þairh leik Xristaus ei wairþaiþ anþaramma þamma us dauþaim urreisandin ei akran bairaima guda

text: For when we were in the flesh , the motions of sins , which were by the law , did work in our members to bring forth fruit unto death .
text2: þan auk wesum in leika winnons frawaurhti þos þairh witoþ waurhtedun in liþum unsaraim du akran bairan dauþau

text: But now we are delivered from the law , that being dead wherein we were held ; that we should serve in newness of spirit , and not in the oldness of the letter .
text2: iþ nu sai andbundanai waurþum af witoda gadauþnandans in þammei gahabaidai wesum swaei skalkinoma in niujiþai ahmins jah ni fairniþai bokos

text: What shall we say then ? Is the law sin ? God forbid . Nay , I had not known sin , but by the law : for I had not known lust , except the law had said , Thou shalt not covet .
text2: ƕa nu qiþam witoþ frawaurhts ist nis sijai ak frawaurht ni ufkunþedjau nih þairh witoþ unte lustu nih wissedjau nih witoþ qeþi ni gairnjais

text: But sin , taking occasion by the commandment , wrought in me all manner of concupiscence . For without the law sin was dead .
text2: iþ lew nimandei frawaurhts þairh anabusn gawaurhta in mis allana lustu unte inu witoþ frawaurhts was nawis

text: For I was alive without the law once : but when the commandment came , sin revived , and I died .
text2: iþ ik qius was inu witoþ simle iþ qimandein anabusnai frawaurhts gaqiunoda

text: And the commandment , which was ordained to life , I found to be unto death .
text2: iþ ik gadauþnoda jah bigitana warþ mis anabusns sei was du libainai wisan du dauþau

text: For sin , taking occasion by the commandment , deceived me , and by it slew me .
text2: unte frawaurhts lew nimandei þairh anabusn uslutoda mik jah þairh þo usqam

text: Wherefore the law is holy , and the commandment holy , and just , and good .
text2: aþþan nu sweþauh witoþ weihata jah anabusns weiha jah garaihta jah þiuþeiga

text: Was then that which is good made death unto me ? God forbid . But sin , that it might appear sin , working death in me by that which is good ; that sin by the commandment might become exceeding sinful .
text2: þata nu þiuþeigo warþ mis dauþus nis sijai ak frawaurhts ei uskunþa waurþi frawaurhts þairh þata þiuþeigo mis gawaurkjandei dauþu ei waurþi ufarassau frawaurhta frawaurhts þairh anabusn

text: For we know that the law is spiritual : but I am carnal , sold under sin .
text2: witum auk þatei witoþ ahmein ist iþ ik leikeins im frabauhts uf frawaurht

text: For that which I do I allow not : for what I would , that do I not ; but what I hate , that do I .
text2: þatei waurkja ni fraþja unte ni þatei wiljau tauja ak þatei fija þata tauja

text: If then I do that which I would not , I consent unto the law that it is good .
text2: iþ jabai þatei ni wiljau þata tauja gaqiss im witoda þatei goþ

text: Now then it is no more I that do it , but sin that dwelleth in me .
text2: iþ nu ju ni ik waurkja þata ak so bauandei in mis frawaurhts

text: For I know that in me ( that is , in my flesh , ) dwelleth no good thing : for to will is present with me ; but how to perform that which is good I find not .
text2: wait auk þatei ni bauiþ in mis þat ist in leika meinamma þiuþ unte wiljan atligiþ mis iþ gawaurkjan goþ ni

text: For the good that I would I do not : but the evil which I would not , that I do .
text2: unte ni þatei wiljau waurkja goþ ak þatei ni wiljau ubil þata tauja

text: Now if I do that I would not , it is no more I that do it , but sin that dwelleth in me .
text2: jabai nu þatei ni wiljau ik þata tauja ju ni ik waurkja ita ak sei bauiþ in mis frawaurhts

text: I find then a law , that , when I would do good , evil is present with me .
text2: bigita nu witoþ wiljandin mis goþ taujan unte mis atist ubil

text: For I delight in the law of God after the inward man :
text2: gawizneigs im auk witoda gudis bi þamma innumin mann

text: But I see another law in my members , warring against the law of my mind , and bringing me into captivity to the law of sin which is in my members .
text2: aþþan gasaiƕa anþar witoþ in liþum meinaim andwaihando witoda ahmins meinis jah frahinþando mik in witoda frawaurhtais þamma wisandin in liþum meinaim

text: O wretched man that I am ! who shall deliver me from the body of this death ?
text2: wainahs ik manna ƕas mik lauseiþ us þamma leika dauþaus þis

text: I thank God through Jesus Christ our Lord . So then with the mind I myself serve the law of God ; but with the flesh the law of sin .
text2: awiliudo guda þairh Iesu Xristu fraujan unsarana jau nu silba ik skalkino gahugdai witoda gudis iþ leika witoda frawaurhtais

text: There is therefore now no condemnation to them which are in Christ Jesus , who walk not after the flesh , but after the Spirit .
text2: Ni waiht þannu nu wargiþos þaim in Xristau Iesu ni gaggandam bi leika

text: For the law of the Spirit of life in Christ Jesus hath made me free from the law of sin and death .
text2: unte witoþ ahmins libainais in Xristau Iesu frijana brahta mik witodis frawaurhtais jah dauþaus

text: For what the law could not do , in that it was weak through the flesh , God sending his own Son in the likeness of sinful flesh , and for sin , condemned sin in the flesh :
text2: unte þata unmahteigo witodis in þammei siuks was þairh leik guþ seinana sunu insandjands in galeikja leikis frawaurhtais jah bi frawaurht gawargida frawaurht in leika

text: That the righteousness of the law might be fulfilled in us , who walk not after the flesh , but after the Spirit .
text2: ei garaihtei witodis usfulljaidau in uns þaim ni bi leika gaggandam ak bi ahmin

text: For they that are after the flesh do mind the things of the flesh ; but they that are after the Spirit the things of the Spirit .
text2: unte þai bi leika wisandans þo þoei leikis sind mitond iþ þai bi ahmin þo þoei ahmins

text: For to be carnally minded is death ; but to be spiritually minded is life and peace .
text2: aþþan fraþi leikis dauþus iþ fraþi ahmins libains jah gawairþi

text: Because the carnal mind is enmity against God : for it is not subject to the law of God , neither indeed can be .
text2: unte fraþi leikis fijands du guda witoda gudis ni ufhauseiþ iþ ni mag

text: So then they that are in the flesh cannot please God .
text2: aþþan þai in leika wisandans guda galeikan ni magun

text: But ye are not in the flesh , but in the Spirit , if so be that the Spirit of God dwell in you . Now if any man have not the Spirit of Christ , he is none of his .
text2: iþ jus ni sijuþ in leika ak in ahmin sweþauh jabai ahma gudis bauiþ in izwis iþ jabai ƕas ahman Xristaus ni habaiþ sa nist is

text: And if Christ be in you , the body is dead because of sin ; but the Spirit is life because of righteousness .
text2: jabai auk Xristus in izwis leik raihtis

text: Who is he that condemneth ? It is Christ that died , yea rather , that is risen again , who is even at the right hand of God , who also maketh intercession for us .
text2: saei ist in taihswon gudis saei jah bidjiþ faur uns

text: Who shall separate us from the love of Christ ? shall tribulation , or distress , or persecution , or famine , or nakedness , or peril , or sword ?
text2: ƕas uns afskaidai af friaþwai Xristaus aglo þau aggwiþa þau wrakja þau huhrus þau naqadei þau sleiþei þau hairus

text: As it is written , For thy sake we are killed all the day long ; we are accounted as sheep for the slaughter .
text2: swaswe gameliþ ist þatei in þuk gadauþjanda all dagis rahnidai wesum swe lamba slauhtais

text: Nay , in all these things we are more than conquerors through him that loved us .
text2: akei in þaim allaim jiukam þairh þana frijondan uns

text: For I am persuaded , that neither death , nor life , nor angels , nor principalities , nor powers , nor things present , nor things to come ,
text2: gatraua auk þatei ni dauþus ni libains nih aggeljus ni reikja ni mahteis nih andwairþo nih anawairþo

text: Nor height , nor depth , nor any other creature , shall be able to separate us from the love of God , which is in Christ Jesus our Lord .
text2: nih hauhiþa nih diupiþa nih gaskafts anþara magi uns afskaidan af friaþwai gudis þizai in Xristau Iesu fraujin unsaramma

text: I say the truth in Christ , I lie not , my conscience also bearing me witness in the Holy Ghost ,
text2: Sunja qiþa ni waiht liuga miþweitwodjandein mis miþwissein meinai in ahmin weihamma

text: That I have great heaviness and continual sorrow in my heart .
text2: þatei saurga mis ist mikila jah unƕeilo aglo hairtin meinamma

text: For I could wish that myself were accursed from Christ for my brethren , my kinsmen according to the flesh :
text2: usbida auk anaþaima wisan silba ik af Xristau faur broþruns meinans þans samakunjans bi leika

text: Who are Israelites ; to whom pertaineth the adoption , and the glory , and the covenants , and the giving of the law , and the service of God , and the promises ;
text2: þaiei sind Israeleitai þizeei ist frastisibja jah wulþus jah witodis garaideins jah triggwos jah skalkinassus jah gahaita

text: Whose are the fathers , and of whom as concerning the flesh Christ came , who is over all , God blessed for ever . Amen .
text2: þizeei attans jah us þaimei Xristus bi leika saei ist ufar allaim guþ þiuþiþs in aiwam amen

text: Not as though the word of God hath taken none effect . For they are not all Israel , which are of Israel :
text2: aþþan sweþauh ni usdraus waurd gudis ni auk allai þai us Israela þai sind Israel

text: Neither , because they are the seed of Abraham , are they all children : but , In Isaac shall thy seed be called .
text2: niþ þatei sijaina fraiw Abrahamis allai barna ak in Isaka haitada þus fraiw

text: That is , They which are the children of the flesh , these are not the children of God : but the children of the promise are counted for the seed .
text2: þat ist ni þo barna leikis barna gudis ak barna gahaitis rahnjanda du fraiwa

text: For this is the word of promise , At this time will I come , and Sara shall have a son .
text2: gahaitis auk waurd þat ist bi þamma mela qima jah wairþiþ Sarrin sunus

text: And not only this ; but when Rebecca also had conceived by one , even by our father Isaac ;
text2: aþþan ni þat - ain ak jah Raibaikka us ainamma galigrja habandei Isakis attins unsaris

text: ( For the children being not yet born , neither having done any good or evil , that the purpose of God according to election might stand , not of works , but of him that calleth ; )
text2: aþþan nauhþanuh ni gabauranai wesun aiþþau tawidedeina ƕa þiuþis aiþþau unþiuþis ei bi gawaleinai muns gudis wisai

text: It was said unto her , The elder shall serve the younger .
text2: ni us waurstwam ak us þamma laþondin qiþan ist izai þatei sa maiza skalkinoþ þamma minnizin

text: As it is written , Jacob have I loved , but Esau have I hated .
text2: swaswe gameliþ ist Iakob frijoda iþ Esaw fijaida

text: What shall we say then ? Is there unrighteousness with God ? God forbid .
text2: ƕa nu qiþam ibai inwindiþa fram guda nis sijai

text: For he saith to Moses , I will have mercy on whom I will have mercy , and I will have compassion on whom I will have compassion .
text2: du Mose auk qiþiþ gaarma þanei arma jah gableiþja þanei bleiþja

text: So then it is not of him that willeth , nor of him that runneth , but of God that sheweth mercy .
text2: þannu nu ni wiljandins ni rinnandins ak armandins gudis

text: For the scripture saith unto Pharaoh , Even for this same purpose have I raised thee up , that I might shew my power in thee , and that my name might be declared throughout all the earth .
text2: qiþiþ auk þata gamelido du Faraoni unte in þize jah raisida þuk ei gabairhtjau bi þus maht meina jah gateihaidau namo mein and alla airþa

text: Therefore hath he mercy on whom he will have mercy , and whom he will he hardeneth .
text2: þannu nu jai þanei wili armaiþ iþ þanei wili gahardeiþ

text: Thou wilt say then unto me , Why doth he yet find fault ? For who hath resisted his will ?
text2: qiþis mis nu aþþan ƕa nauh faianda unte wiljin is ƕas andstandiþ

text: Nay but , O man , who art thou that repliest against God ? Shall the thing formed say to him that formed it , Why hast thou made me thus ?
text2: þannu nu jai manna þu ƕas is ei andwaurdjais guda ibai qiþiþ gadikis du þamma digandin ƕa mik gatawides swa

text: Hath not the potter power over the clay , of the same lump to make one vessel unto honour , and another unto dishonour ?
text2: þau niu habaiþ kasja waldufni þahons us þamma samin daiga taujan sum du galaubamma kasa sum uþ þan du ungalaubamma

text: What if God , willing to shew his wrath , and to make his power known , endured with much longsuffering the vessels of wrath fitted to destruction :
text2: iþ jabai wiljands guþ ustaiknjan þwairhein jah uskannjan þata mahteigo usbeidands was in managai laggamodein bi kasam þwairheins gamanwidaim du fralustai

text: And that he might make known the riches of his glory on the vessels of mercy , which he had afore prepared unto glory ,
text2: ei gakannidedi gabein wulþaus seinis bi kasam armaions þoei fauragamanwida du wulþau

text: Even us , whom he hath called , not of the Jews only , but also of the Gentiles ?
text2: þanzei jah laþoda uns ni þatainei us Iudaium ak jah us þiudom

text: As he saith also in Osee , I will call them my people , which were not my people ; and her beloved , which was not beloved .
text2: swaswe jah in Osaiin qiþiþ haita þo ni managein meina managein meina jah þo unliubon liubon

text: And it shall come to pass , that in the place where it was said unto them , Ye are not my people ; there shall they be called the children of the living God .
text2: jah wairþiþ in þamma stada þarei qiþada im ni managei meina jus þai haitanda sunjus gudis libandins

text: Esaias also crieth concerning Israel , Though the number of the children of Israel be as the sand of the sea , a remnant shall be saved :
text2: iþ Esaïas hropeiþ bi Israel jabai wesi raþjo suniwe Israelis swaswe malma mareins laibos ganisand

text: For he will finish the work , and cut it short in righteousness : because a short work will the Lord make upon the earth .
text2: waurd auk ustiuhands jah gamaurgjands in garaihtein unte waurd gamaurgiþ taujiþ frauja ana airþai

text: And as Esaias said before , Except the Lord of Sabaoth had left us a seed , we had been as Sodoma , and been made like unto Gomorrha .
text2: jah swaswe fauraqaþ Esaïas nih frauja Sabaoþ biliþi unsis fraiwa swe Saudauma þau waurþeima jah swe Gaumaurra þau galeikai waurþeima

text: What shall we say then ? That the Gentiles , which followed not after righteousness , have attained to righteousness , even the righteousness which is of faith .
text2: ƕa nu qiþam þatei þiudos þos ni laistjandeins garaihtein gafaifahun garaihtein aþþan garaihtein þo us galaubeinai

text: But Israel , which followed after the law of righteousness , hath not attained to the law of righteousness .
text2: iþ Israel laistjands witoþ garaihteins bi witoþ garaihteins ni gasnau

text: Wherefore ? Because they sought it not by faith , but as it were by the works of the law . For they stumbled at that stumblingstone ;
text2: Duƕe unte ni us galaubeinai ak us waurstwam witodis bistuggqun du staina bistuggqis

text: As it is written , Behold , I lay in Sion a stumblingstone and rock of offence : and whosoever believeth on him shall not be ashamed .
text2: swaswe gameliþ ist sai galagja in Sion stain bistuggqis jah hallu gamarzeinais jah sa galaubjands du imma ni gaaiwiskoda

text: Brethren , my heart ' s desire and prayer to God for Israel is , that they might be saved .
text2: Broþrjus sa raihtis wilja meinis hairtins jah bida du guda bi ins du naseinai

text: For I bear them record that they have a zeal of God , but not according to knowledge .
text2: weitwodja auk im þatei aljan gudis haband akei ni bi kunþja

text: For they being ignorant of God ' s righteousness , and going about to establish their own righteousness , have not submitted themselves unto the righteousness of God .
text2: unkunnandans auk gudis garaihtein jah seina garaihtein sokjandans stiurjan garaihtein gudis ni ufhausidedun

text: For Christ is the end of the law for righteousness to every one that believeth .
text2: ustauhts auk witodis Xristus du garaihtein allaim þaim galaubjandam

text: For Moses describeth the righteousness which is of the law , That the man which doeth those things shall live by them .
text2: Moses auk meleiþ þo garaihtein us witoda þatei sa taujands þo manna libaiþ in izai

text: But the righteousness which is of faith speaketh on this wise , Say not in thine heart , Who shall ascend into heaven ? ( that is , to bring Christ down from above : )
text2: iþ so us galaubeinai garaihtei swa qiþiþ ni qiþais in hairtin þeinamma ƕas ussteigiþ in himin þat ist Xristu dalaþ attiuhan

text: Or , Who shall descend into the deep ? ( that is , to bring up Christ again from the dead . )
text2: aiþþau ƕas gasteigiþ in afgrundiþa þat ist Xristu us dauþaim iup ustiuhan

text: But what saith it ? The word is nigh thee , even in thy mouth , and in thy heart : that is , the word of faith , which we preach ;
text2: akei ƕa qiþiþ neƕa þus þata waurd ist in munþa þeinamma jah in hairtin þeinamma þat ist waurd galaubeinais þatei merjam

text: That if thou shalt confess with thy mouth the Lord Jesus , and shalt believe in thine heart that God hath raised him from the dead , thou shalt be saved .
text2: þei jabai andhaitis in munþa þeinamma fraujin Iesu jah galaubeis in hairtin þeinamma þatei guþ ina urraisida us dauþaim ganisis

text: For with the heart man believeth unto righteousness ; and with the mouth confession is made unto salvation .
text2: hairto auk galaubeiþ du garaihtiþai iþ munþa andhaitada du ganistai

text: For the scripture saith , Whosoever believeth on him shall not be ashamed .
text2: qiþiþ auk þata gameliþ ƕazuh sa galaubjands du imma ni gaaiwiskoda

text: For there is no difference between the Jew and the Greek : for the same Lord over all is rich unto all that call upon him .
text2: ni auk ist gaskaideins Iudaiaus jah Krekis sa sama auk frauja allaize gabigs in allans þans bidjandans sik

text: For whosoever shall call upon the name of the Lord shall be saved .
text2: ƕazuh auk saei anahaitiþ bidai namo fraujins ganisiþ

text: How then shall they call on him in whom they have not believed ? and how shall they believe in him of whom they have not heard ? and how shall they hear without a preacher ?
text2: ƕaiwa nu bidjand du þammei ni galaubidedun aiþþau ƕaiwa galaubjand þammei ni hausidedun iþ ƕaiwa hausjand inu merjandan

text: And how shall they preach , except they be sent ? as it is written , How beautiful are the feet of them that preach the gospel of peace , and bring glad tidings of good things !
text2: iþ ƕaiwa merjand niba insandjanda swaswe gameliþ ist ƕaiwa skaunjai fotjus þize spillondane gawairþi þize spillondane þiuþ

text: But they have not all obeyed the gospel . For Esaias saith , Lord , who hath believed our report ?
text2: akei ni allai ufhausidedun aiwaggeljon Esaïas auk qiþiþ frauja ƕas galaubida hauseinai unsarai

text: So then faith cometh by hearing , and hearing by the word of God .
text2: þannu galaubeins us gahauseinai iþ gahauseins þairh waurd Xristaus

text: But I say , Have they not heard ? Yes verily , their sound went into all the earth , and their words unto the ends of the world .
text2: akei qiþa ibai ni hausidedun raihtis and alla airþa galaiþ drunjus ize jah and andins midjungardis waurda ize

text: But I say , Did not Israel know ? First Moses saith , I will provoke you to jealousy by them that are no people , and by a foolish nation I will anger you .
text2: akei qiþa ibai Israel ni fanþ frumist Moses qiþiþ ik in aljana izwis brigga in unþiudom in þiudai unfraþjandein in þwairhein izwis brigga

text: But Esaias is very bold , and saith , I was found of them that sought me not ; I was made manifest unto them that asked not after me .
text2: iþ Esaïas anananþeiþ jah qiþiþ bigitans warþ þaim mik ni gasokjandam swikunþs warþ þaim mik ni gafraihnandam

text: But to Israel he saith , All day long I have stretched forth my hands unto a disobedient and gainsaying people .
text2: iþ du Israela qiþiþ allana dag usbraidida þos handuns meinos du managein ungalaubjandein jah andstandandein

text: I say then , Hath God cast away his people ? God forbid . For I also am an Israelite , of the seed of Abraham , of the tribe of Benjamin .
text2: Qiþa nu ibai afskauf guþ arbja seinamma nis sijai jah auk ik Israeleites im

text: I say then , Have they stumbled that they should fall ? God forbid : but rather through their fall salvation is come unto the Gentiles , for to provoke them to jealousy .
text2: ei gadruseina nis sijai ak þizai ize missadedai ganists þiudom du in aljana briggan ins

text: Now if the fall of them be the riches of the world , and the diminishing of them the riches of the Gentiles ; how much more their fulness ?
text2: iþ jabai missadeds ize gabei fairƕau jah wanains ize gabei þiudom ƕan mais fullo ize

text: For I speak to you Gentiles , inasmuch as I am the apostle of the Gentiles , I magnify mine office :
text2: izwis auk qiþa þiudom swa lagga swe ik im þiudo apaustaulus andbahti mein mikilja

text: If by any means I may provoke to emulation them which are my flesh , and might save some of them .
text2: ei ƕaiwa in aljana briggau leik mein jah ganasjau sumans us im

text: For if the casting away of them be the reconciling of the world , what shall the receiving of them be , but life from the dead ?
text2: jabai auk uswaurpa ize gabei fairƕaus ƕa so andanumts nibai libains us dauþaim

text: For if the firstfruit be holy , the lump is also holy : and if the root be holy , so are the branches .
text2: þandei ufarskafts weiha jah daigs jah jabai waurts weiha jah astos

text: And if some of the branches be broken off , and thou , being a wild olive tree , wert graffed in among them , and with them partakest of the root and fatness of the olive tree ;
text2: iþ jabai sumai þize aste usbruknodedun iþ þu wilþeis alewabagms wisands intrusgiþs warst in ins jah gamains þizai waurhtai jah smairþra alewabagmis warst

text: Boast not against the branches . But if thou boast , thou bearest not the root , but the root thee .
text2: ni ƕop ana þans astans iþ jabai ƕopis ni þu þo waurt bairis ak so waurts þuk

text: Thou wilt say then , The branches were broken off , that I might be graffed in .
text2: qiþais nu usbruknodedun astos ei ik intrusgjaidau

text: Well ; because of unbelief they were broken off , and thou standest by faith . Be not highminded , but fear :
text2: waila ungalaubeinai usbruknodedun iþ þu galaubeinai gastost ni hugei hauhaba ak ogs

text: For if God spared not the natural branches , take heed lest he also spare not thee .
text2: þandei guþ þans us gabaurþai astans ni freidida ibai aufto ni þuk freidjai

text: Behold therefore the goodness and severity of God : on them which fell , severity ; but toward thee , goodness , if thou continue in his goodness : otherwise thou also shalt be cut off .
text2: sai nu selein jah ƕassein gudis aþþan ana þaim þaiei gadrusun ƕassein iþ ana þus selein jabai þairhwisis in selein aiþþau jah þu usmaitaza

text: And they also , if they abide not still in unbelief , shall be graffed in : for God is able to graff them in again .
text2: jah jainai niba gatulgjand sik in ungalaubeinai intrusgjanda mahteigs auk ist guþ aftra intrusgjan ins

text: For if thou wert cut out of the olive tree which is wild by nature , and wert graffed contrary to nature into a good olive tree : how much more shall these , which be the natural branches , be graffed into their own olive tree ?
text2: jabai auk þu us wistai usmaitans þis wilþeins alewabagmis jah aljakuns wisands intrusgans warst in godana alewabagm ƕan filu mais þai bi wistai intrusgjanda in swesana alewabagm

text: For I would not , brethren , that ye should be ignorant of this mystery , lest ye should be wise in your own conceits ; that blindness in part is happened to Israel , until the fulness of the Gentiles be come in .
text2: ni auk wiljau izwis unweisans broþrjus þizos runos ei ni sijaiþ in izwis silbam frodai unte daubei bi sumata Israela warþ und þatei fullo þiudo inngaleiþai

text: And so all Israel shall be saved : as it is written , There shall come out of Sion the Deliverer , and shall turn away ungodliness from Jacob :
text2: jah swa allai Israel ganisand swaswe gameliþ ist urrinniþ us Sion sa lausjands du afwandjan afgudein af Iakoba

text: For this is my covenant unto them , when I shall take away their sins .
text2: jah so im fram mis triggwa þan afnima frawaurhtins ize

text: As concerning the gospel , they are enemies for your sakes : but as touching the election , they are beloved for the fathers ' sakes .
text2: aþþan bi aiwaggeljon fijandans in izwara iþ bi gawaleinai liubai ana attans

text: For the gifts and calling of God are without repentance .
text2: inu idreiga sind auk gibos jah laþons gudis

text: For as ye in times past have not believed God , yet have now obtained mercy through their unbelief :
text2: swaswe raihtis jus suman ni galaubideduþ guda iþ nu gaarmaidai waurþuþ þizai ize ungalaubeinai

text: Even so have these also now not believed , that through your mercy they also may obtain mercy .
text2: swa jah þai nu ni galaubidedun izwarai armaion ei jah eis gaarmaindau

text: For God hath concluded them all in unbelief , that he might have mercy upon all .
text2: galauk auk guþ allans in ungalaubeinai ei allans gaarmai

text: O the depth of the riches both of the wisdom and knowledge of God ! how unsearchable are his judgments , and his ways past finding out !
text2: o diupiþa gabeins handugeins

text: For who hath known the mind of the Lord ? or who hath been his counseller ?
text2: ƕas auk ufkunþa fraþi fraujins aiþþau ƕas imma ragineis was

text: Or who hath first given to him , and it shall be recompensed unto him again ?
text2: aiþþau ƕas imma fruma gaf jah fragildaidau imma

text: For of him , and through him , and to him , are all things : to whom be glory for ever . Amen .
text2: unte us imma jah þairh ina jah in imma alla imm uh wulþus du aiwam amen

text: I beseech you therefore , brethren , by the mercies of God , that ye present your bodies a living sacrifice , holy , acceptable unto God , which is your reasonable service .
text2: Bidja nu izwis broþrjus þairh bleiþein gudis usgiban leika izwara saud qiwana weihana waila galeikaidana guda andaþahtana blotinassu izwarana

text: And be not conformed to this world : but be ye transformed by the renewing of your mind , that ye may prove what is that good , and acceptable , and perfect , will of God .
text2: ni galeikoþ izwis þamma aiwa ak inmaidjaiþ ananiujiþai fraþjis izwaris du gakiusan ƕa sijai wilja gudis þatei goþ jah galeikaiþ jah ustauhan

text: For I say , through the grace given unto me , to every man that is among you , not to think of himself more highly than he ought to think ; but to think soberly , according as God hath dealt to every man the measure of faith .
text2: qiþa auk þairh anst gudis sei gibana ist mis allaim wisandam in izwis ni mais fraþjan þau skuli fraþjan ak fraþjan du waila fraþjan ƕarjammeh swaswe guþ gadailida mitaþ galaubeinais

text: For as we have many members in one body , and all members have not the same office :
text2: swaswe raihtis in ainamma leika liþuns managans habam þai þ þan liþjus allai ni þata samo taui haband

text: So we , being many , are one body in Christ , and every one members one of another .
text2: swa managai ain leik sijum in Xristau aþþan ainƕarjizuh anþar anþaris liþjus

text: Or he that exhorteth , on exhortation : he that giveth , let him do it with simplicity ; he that ruleth , with diligence ; he that sheweth mercy , with cheerfulness .
text2: sa dailjands in allawerein sa faurastandands in usdaudein sa armands in hlasein

text: Let love be without dissimulation . Abhor that which is evil ; cleave to that which is good .
text2: friaþwa unliuta fiandans ubila haftjandans godamma

text: Be kindly affectioned one to another with brotherly love ; in honour preferring one another ;
text2: broþralubon in izwis misso friaþwamildjai sweriþai izwis misso faurarahnjandans

text: Not slothful in business ; fervent in spirit ; serving the Lord ;
text2: usdaudein ni latai ahmin wulandans fraujin skalkinondans

text: Rejoicing in hope ; patient in tribulation ; continuing instant in prayer ;
text2: wenai faginondans aglons usþulandans bidai haftjandans

text: Distributing to the necessity of saints ; given to hospitality .
text2: andawiznim weihaize gamainjandans gastigodein galaistjandans

text: Bless them which persecute you : bless , and curse not .
text2: þiuþjaiþ þans wrikandans izwis þiuþjaiþ jah ni unþiuþjaiþ

text: Rejoice with them that do rejoice , and weep with them that weep .
text2: faginon miþ faginondam gretan miþ gretandam

text: Be of the same mind one toward another . Mind not high things , but condescend to men of low estate . Be not wise in your own conceits .
text2: þata samo in izwis misso fraþjandans ni hauhaba hugjandans ak þaim hnaiwam miþgawisandans ni wairþaiþ inahai bi izwis silbam

text: Recompense to no man evil for evil . Provide things honest in the sight of all men .
text2: ni ainummehun ubil und ubilamma usgibandans bisaiƕandans godis ni þatainei in andwairþja gudis ak jah in andwairþja manne allaize

text: If it be possible , as much as lieth in you , live peaceably with all men .
text2: jabai magi wairþan us izwis miþ allaim mannam gawairþi habandans

text: Dearly beloved , avenge not yourselves , but rather give place unto wrath : for it is written , Vengeance is mine ; I will repay , saith the Lord .
text2: ni izwis silbans gawrikandans liubans ak gibiþ staþ þwairhein gameliþ ist auk mis fraweit leitaidau ik fragilda qiþiþ frauja

text: Therefore if thine enemy hunger , feed him ; if he thirst , give him drink : for in so doing thou shalt heap coals of fire on his head .
text2: jabai gredo fijand þeinana mat gif imma iþ jabai þaursjai dragkei ina þata auk taujands haurja funins rikis ana haubiþ is

text: Be not overcome of evil , but overcome evil with good .
text2: ni gajiukaizau af unþiuþa ak gajiukais þiuþa unþiuþ

text: Let every soul be subject unto the higher powers . For there is no power but of God : the powers that be are ordained of God .
text2: All saiwalo waldufnjam ufarwisandam ufhausjai unte nist waldufni alja fram guda iþ þo wisandona fram guda gasatida sind

text: Whosoever therefore resisteth the power , resisteth the ordinance of God : and they that resist shall receive to themselves damnation .
text2: swaei sa andstandands waldufnja gudis garaideinai andstoþ iþ þai andstandandans silbans sis wargiþa nimand

text: For rulers are not a terror to good works , but to the evil . Wilt thou then not be afraid of the power ? do that which is good , and thou shalt have praise of the same :
text2: þai auk reiks ni sind agis godamma waurstwa ak ubilamma aþþan wileis ei ni ogeis waldufni þiuþ taujais jah habais hazein us þamma

text: For he is the minister of God to thee for good . But if thou do that which is evil , be afraid ; for he beareth not the sword in vain : for he is the minister of God , a revenger to execute wrath upon him that doeth evil .
text2: unte gudis andbahts ist þus in godamma iþ jabai ubil taujis ogs unte ni sware þana hairau bairiþ gudis auk andbahts ist fraweitands in þwairhein þamma ubil taujandin

text: Wherefore ye must needs be subject , not only for wrath , but also for conscience sake .
text2: duþþe ufhausjaiþ ni þatainei in þwairheins ak jah in miþwisseins

text: For for this cause pay ye tribute also : for they are God ' s ministers , attending continually upon this very thing .
text2: in uþ þis auk jah gilstra ustiuhaiþ unte andbahtos gudis sind in þamma silbin skalkinondans

text: Render therefore to all their dues : tribute to whom tribute is due ; custom to whom custom ; fear to whom fear ; honour to whom honour .
text2: usgibiþ nu allaim skuldo þammei gabaur gabaur þammei mota mota þammei agis agis þammei sweriþa sweriþa

text: Owe no man any thing , but to love one another : for he that loveth another hath fulfilled the law .
text2: ni ainummehun waihtais skulans sijaiþ niba þatei izwis misso frijoþ unte saei frijoþ neƕundjan witoþ usfullida

text: For this , Thou shalt not commit adultery , Thou shalt not kill , Thou shalt not steal , Thou shalt not bear false witness , Thou shalt not covet ; and if there be any other commandment , it is briefly comprehended in this saying , namely , Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself .
text2: þata auk ni horinos ni maurþrjais ni hlifais nih faihugeigais jah jabai ƕo anþaraizo anabusne ist in þamma waurda usfulljada þamma frijos neƕundjan þeinana swe þuk silban

text: Love worketh no ill to his neighbour : therefore love is the fulfilling of the law .
text2: friaþwa neƕundjins ubil ni waurkeiþ usfulleins nu witodis ist friaþwa

text: And that , knowing the time , that now it is high time to awake out of sleep : for now is our salvation nearer than when we believed .
text2: jah þata witandans þata þeihs þatei mel ist uns ju us slepa urreisan unte nu neƕis ist naseins unsara þau þan galaubidedum

text: The night is far spent , the day is at hand : let us therefore cast off the works of darkness , and let us put on the armour of light .
text2: nahts framis galaiþ iþ dags atneƕida uswairpam nu waurstwam riqizis iþ gawasjam sarwam liuhadis

text: Let us walk honestly , as in the day ; not in rioting and drunkenness , not in chambering and wantonness , not in strife and envying .
text2: swe in daga garedaba gaggaima ni gabauram jah drugkaneim ni ligram jah aglaitjam ni haifstai jah aljana

text: But put ye on the Lord Jesus Christ , and make not provision for the flesh , to fulfil the lusts thereof .
text2: ak gahamoþ fraujin unsaramma Xristau Iesua jah leikis mun ni taujaiþ in lustuns

text: Him that is weak in the faith receive ye , but not to doubtful disputations .
text2: Iþ unmahteigana galaubeinai andnimaiþ ni du tweifleinai mitone

text: For one believeth that he may eat all things : another , who is weak , eateth herbs .
text2: sums raihtis galaubeiþ matjan allata iþ saei unmahteigs ist gras matjiþ

text: Let not him that eateth despise him that eateth not ; and let not him which eateth not judge him that eateth : for God hath received him .
text2: sa matjands þamma ni matjandin ni frakunni iþ sa ni matjands þana matjandan ni stojai guþ auk ina andnam

text: Who art thou that judgest another man ' s servant ? to his own master he standeth or falleth . Yea , he shall be holden up : for God is able to make him stand .
text2: þu ƕas is þuei stojis framaþjana skalk seinamma fraujin standiþ aiþþau driusiþ aþþan standiþ mahteigs auk ist frauja gastoþan ina

text: One man esteemeth one day above another : another esteemeth every day alike . Let every man be fully persuaded in his own mind .
text2: sums raihtis stojiþ dag hindar daga

text: For to this end Christ both died , and rose , and revived , that he might be Lord both of the dead and living .
text2: jah qiwaim jah dauþaim fraujinoþ

text: But why dost thou judge thy brother ? or why dost thou set at nought thy brother ? for we shall all stand before the judgment seat of Christ .
text2: iþ þu ƕa stojis broþar þeinana aiþþau jah þu ƕa frakant broþr þeinamma allai auk gasatjanda faura stauastola Xristaus

text: For it is written , As I live , saith the Lord , every knee shall bow to me , and every tongue shall confess to God .
text2: gameliþ ist auk liba ik qiþiþ frauja þatei mis all kniwe biugiþ jah andhaitiþ all razdo guda

text: So then every one of us shall give account of himself to God .
text2: þannu nu ƕarjizuh unsara fram sis raþjon usgibiþ guda

text: Let us not therefore judge one another any more : but judge this rather , that no man put a stumblingblock or an occasion to fall in his brother ' s way .
text2: ni þanamais nu uns misso stojaima ak þata stojaiþ mais ei ni satjaiþ bistugq broþr aiþþau gamarzein

text: I know , and am persuaded by the Lord Jesus , that there is nothing unclean of itself : but to him that esteemeth any thing to be unclean , to him it is unclean .
text2: wait jag gatraua in fraujin Iesua þatei ni waiht gawamm þairh sik silbo niba þamma munandin ƕa unhrain wisan þamma gamain ist

text: But if thy brother be grieved with thy meat , now walkest thou not charitably . Destroy not him with thy meat , for whom Christ died .
text2: iþ jabai in matis broþar þeins gaurjada ju ni bi friaþwai gaggis ni nunu mata þeinamma jainamma fraqistjais faur þanei Xristus gaswalt

text: Let not then your good be evil spoken of :
text2: ni wajamerjaidau unsar þiuþ

text: For the kingdom of God is not meat and drink ; but righteousness , and peace , and joy in the Holy Ghost .
text2: nist auk þiudangardi gudis mats jah dragk ak garaihtei jah gawairþi jah faheþs in ahmin weihamma

text: For he that in these things serveth Christ is acceptable to God , and approved of men .
text2: saei auk in þaim skalkinoþ Xristau waila galeikaiþ guda jah gakusans ist mannam

text: Let us therefore follow after the things which make for peace , and things wherewith one may edify another .
text2: þannu nu þoei gawairþjis sind laistjaima jah þoei timreinais sind in uns misso

text: For meat destroy not the work of God . All things indeed are pure ; but it is evil for that man who eateth with offence .
text2: ni nunu in matis gatair waurstw gudis

text: For even Christ pleased not himself ; but , as it is written , The reproaches of them that reproached thee fell on me .
text2: þize idweitjandane þuk gadrusun ana mik

text: For whatsoever things were written aforetime were written for our learning , that we through patience and comfort of the scriptures might have hope .
text2: swa filu auk swe fauragameliþ warþ du unsarai laiseinai gameliþ warþ ei þairh þulain jah gaþrafstein boko wen habaima

text: Now the God of patience and consolation grant you to be likeminded one toward another according to Christ Jesus :
text2: iþ guþ þulainais jah þrafsteinais gibai izwis þata samo fraþjan in izwis misso bi Xristu Iesu

text: That ye may with one mind and one mouth glorify God , even the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ .
text2: ei gawiljai ainamma munþa hauhjaiþ guþ jah attan fraujins unsaris Iesuis Xristaus

text: Wherefore receive ye one another , as Christ also received us to the glory of God .
text2: in þizei andnimaiþ izwis misso swaswe jah Xristus andnam izwis du wulþau gudis

text: Now I say that Jesus Christ was a minister of the circumcision for the truth of God , to confirm the promises made unto the fathers :
text2: qiþa auk Xristu Iesu andbaht waurþanana bimaitis fram sunjai gudis du gatulgjan gahaita attane

text: And that the Gentiles might glorify God for his mercy ; as it is written , For this cause I will confess to thee among the Gentiles , and sing unto thy name .
text2: iþ þiudos in armahairteins hauhjan guþ swaswe gameliþ ist duþþe andhaita þus in þiudom frauja jah namin þeinamma liuþo

text: And again he saith , Rejoice , ye Gentiles , with his people .
text2: jah aftra qiþiþ sifaiþ þiudos miþ managein is

text: And again , Praise the Lord , all ye Gentiles ; and laud him , all ye people .
text2: jah aftra qiþiþ hazjiþ allos þiudos fraujan jah hazjaina ina allos manageins

text: And again , Esaias saith , There shall be a root of Jesse , and he that shall rise to reign over the Gentiles ; in him shall the Gentiles trust .
text2: jah aftra Esaeias qiþiþ wairþiþ waurts Iaissaizis jah sa usstandands reikinoþ þiudom du imma þiudos wenjand

text: Now the God of hope fill you with all joy and peace in believing , that ye may abound in hope , through the power of the Holy Ghost .
text2: iþ guþ lubainais fulljai izwis allaizos fahedais

text: Timotheus my workfellow , and Lucius , and Jason , and Sosipater , my kinsmen , salute you .
text2: jah Lukius jah Iasson jah Soseipatrus þai niþjos meinai

text: I Tertius , who wrote this epistle , salute you in the Lord .
text2: golja izwis ik Tairtius sa meljands þo aipistaulein in fraujin

text: Gaius mine host , and of the whole church , saluteth you . Erastus the chamberlain of the city saluteth you , and Quartus a brother .
text2: goleiþ izwis Gaïus wairdus meins jah allaizos aikklesjons goleiþ izwis Airastus fauragaggja baurgs jah Qartus sa broþar

text: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all . Amen .
text2: ansts fraujins unsaris Iesuis Xristaus miþ ahmin izwaramma Amen

text: Now this I say , that every one of you saith , I am of Paul ; and I of Apollos ; and I of Cephas ; and I of Christ .
text2: ik im Pawlus iþ ik Apaullons iþ ik Kefins iþ ik Xristaus

text: Is Christ divided ? was Paul crucified for you ? or were ye baptized in the name of Paul ?
text2: disdailiþs ist Xristus ibai Pawlus ushramiþs warþ in izwara aiþþau in namin Pawlus daupidai weseiþ

text: I thank God that I baptized none of you , but Crispus and Gaius ;
text2: awiliudo guda ei ainnohun izwara ni daupida niba Krispu jah Gaïu

text: Lest any should say that I had baptized in mine own name .
text2: ei ƕas ni qiþai þatei in meinamma namin daupidedjau

text: And I baptized also the household of Stephanas : besides , I know not whether I baptized any other .
text2: ik daupida auk jaþ þans Staifanaus gadaukans þata anþar ni wait ei ainnohun daupidedjau

text: For Christ sent me not to baptize , but to preach the gospel : not with wisdom of words , lest the cross of Christ should be made of none effect .
text2: niþ þan insandida mik Xristus daupjan ak wailamerjan ni in snutrein waurdis ei ni uslausjaidau galga Xristaus

text: For the preaching of the cross is to them that perish foolishness ; but unto us which are saved it is the power of God .
text2: unte þata waurd galgins þaim fralusnandam dwaliþa ist iþ þaim ganisandam mahts gudis ist

text: For it is written , I will destroy the wisdom of the wise , and will bring to nothing the understanding of the prudent .
text2: gameliþ ist auk fraqistja snutrein þize snutrane jah frodein þize frodane uskiusa

text: Where is the wise ? where is the scribe ? where is the disputer of this world ? hath not God made foolish the wisdom of this world ?
text2: ƕar handugs ƕar bokareis ƕar sokareis þis aiwis nih dwala gatawida guþ handugein þis fairƕaus

text: For after that in the wisdom of God the world by wisdom knew not God , it pleased God by the foolishness of preaching to save them that believe .
text2: unte auk in handugein gudis ni ufkunnaida sa fairƕus þairh handugein guþ galeikaida guda þairh þo dwaliþa þizos wailamereinais ganasjan þans galaubjandans

text: For the Jews require a sign , and the Greeks seek after wisdom :
text2: unte Iudaieis taikne bidjand iþ Krekos handugein sokjand

text: But we preach Christ crucified , unto the Jews a stumblingblock , and unto the Greeks foolishness ;
text2: iþ weis merjam Iesu ushramidana Iudaium gamarzein iþ þiudom dwaliþa

text: But unto them which are called , both Jews and Greeks , Christ the power of God , and the wisdom of God .
text2: iþ þaim galaþodam Iudaie jah þiudo Xristu gudis maht jah gudis handugein

text: Because the foolishness of God is wiser than men ; and the weakness of God is stronger than men .
text2: unte so dwaliþa gudis handugozei mannam

text: Moreover it is required in stewards , that a man be found faithful .
text2: ei ƕas triggws bigitaidau

text: But with me it is a very small thing that I should be judged of you , or of man ' s judgment : yea , I judge not mine own self .
text2: aþþan mis in minnistin ist ei fram izwis ussokjaidau aiþþau fram manniskamma daga akei nih mik silban ussokja

text: For I know nothing by myself ; yet am I not hereby justified : but he that judgeth me is the Lord .
text2: nih waiht auk mis silbin miþwait akei ni in þamma garaihtiþs im iþ saei ussokeiþ mik frauja ist

text: Therefore judge nothing before the time , until the Lord come , who both will bring to light the hidden things of darkness , and will make manifest the counsels of the hearts : and then shall every man have praise of God .
text2: þannu nu ei faur mel ni stojaiþ unte qimai frauja saei jah galiuhteiþ analaugn riqizis jah gabairhteiþ runos hairtane jaþ þan hazeins wairþiþ ƕarjammeh fram guda

text: And these things , brethren , I have in a figure transferred to myself and to Apollos for your sakes ; that ye might learn in us not to think of men above that which is written , that no one of you be puffed up for one against another .
text2: aþþan þo broþrjus þairhgaleikoda in mis jah Apaullon in izwara ei in ugkis ganimaiþ ni ufar þatei gameliþ ist fraþjan ei ains faur ainana ana anþarana ufblesans ni sijai

text: For who maketh thee to differ from another ? and what hast thou that thou didst not receive ? now if thou didst receive it , why dost thou glory , as if thou hadst not received it ?
text2: ƕas auk þuk ussokeiþ ƕa uþ þan habais þatei ni namt aiþþau jabai andnamt ƕa ƕopis swe ni nemeis

text: Now ye are full , now ye are rich , ye have reigned as kings without us : and I would to God ye did reign , that we also might reign with you .
text2: ju sadai sijuþ ju gabigai waurþuþ inu uns þiudanodeduþ jah wainei þiudanodedeiþ ei jah weis izwis miþþiudanoma

text: For I think that God hath set forth us the apostles last , as it were appointed to death : for we are made a spectacle unto the world , and to angels , and to men .
text2: man auk þei guþ uns apaustauluns spedistans ustaiknida swaswe dauþubljans unte fairweitl waurþum þizai manasedai jah aggilum jah mannam

text: We are fools for Christ ' s sake , but ye are wise in Christ ; we are weak , but ye are strong ; ye are honourable , but we are despised .
text2: weis dwalai in Xristaus iþ jus frodai in Xristau weiz uþ þan unmahteigai iþ jus swinþai juz uþ þan wulþagai iþ weis unswerai

text: Even unto this present hour we both hunger , and thirst , and are naked , and are buffeted , and have no certain dwellingplace ;
text2: und þo nu ƕeila jah huggridai jah þaursidai jah naqadai jah kaupatidai jah ungastoþai

text: And labour , working with our own hands : being reviled , we bless ; being persecuted , we suffer it :
text2: jah

text: For I verily , as absent in body , but present in spirit , have judged already , as though I were present , concerning him that hath so done this deed ,
text2: ju gastauida swe andwairþs þana swa þata gataujandan

text: In the name of our Lord Jesus Christ , when ye are gathered together , and my spirit , with the power of our Lord Jesus Christ ,
text2: in namin fraujins unsaris Iesuis Xristaus samaþ gagaggandam izwis jah meinamma ahmin miþ mahtai fraujins unsaris Iesuis Xristaus

text: To deliver such an one unto Satan for the destruction of the flesh , that the spirit may be saved in the day of the Lord Jesus .
text2: atgiban þana swaleikana unhulþin du qisteinai leikis ei ahma ganisai in daga fraujins Iesuis

text: Your glorying is not good . Know ye not that a little leaven leaveneth the whole lump ?
text2: ni goda so ƕoftuli izwara niu wituþ þatei leitil beistis allana daig gabeisteiþ

text: Purge out therefore the old leaven , that ye may be a new lump , as ye are unleavened . For even Christ our passover is sacrificed for us :
text2: ushraineiþ þata fairnjo beist ei sijaiþ niujis daigs swaswe sijaiþ unbeistjodai jah auk paska unsara ufsniþans ist faur uns Xristus

text: Therefore let us keep the feast , not with old leaven , neither with the leaven of malice and wickedness ; but with the unleavened bread of sincerity and truth .
text2: þannu dulþjam ni in beista fairnjamma niþ þan in beista balwaweseins jah unseleins ak in unbeistein unwammeins jas sunjos

text: I wrote unto you in an epistle not to company with fornicators :
text2: gamelida izwis ana þizai aipistaulein ni blandaiþ izwis horam

text: Yet not altogether with the fornicators of this world , or with the covetous , or extortioners , or with idolaters ; for then must ye needs go out of the world .
text2: ni þaim horam þis fairƕaus aiþþau þaim faihufrikam jah wilwam aiþþau galiugam skalkinondam unte skuldedeiþ þan us þamma fairƕau usgaggan

text: But now I have written unto you not to keep company , if any man that is called a brother be a fornicator , or covetous , or an idolater , or a railer , or a drunkard , or an extortioner ; with such an one no not to eat .
text2: iþ nu gamelida izwis ni blandan jabai ƕas broþar namnids sijai hors aiþþau faihufriks aiþþau galiugam skalkinonds aiþþau ubilwaurds aiþþau afdrugkja aiþþau wilwa þamma swaleikamma ni miþmatjan

text: For what have I to do to judge them also that are without ? do not ye judge them that are within ?
text2: ƕa mik jah þans uta stojan niu þans inna jus stojiþ

text: But them that are without God judgeth . Therefore put away from among yourselves that wicked person .
text2: iþ þans uta guþ stojiþ usnimiþ þana ubilan us izwis silbam

text: Dare any of you , having a matter against another , go to law before the unjust , and not before the saints ?
text2: Gadars ƕas izwara wiþra anþarana staua habands stojan fram inwindaim jah ni fram

text: Defraud ye not one the other , except it be with consent for a time , that ye may give yourselves to fasting and prayer ; and come together again , that Satan tempt you not for your incontinency .
text2: izwara misso niba þau us gaqissai ƕo ƕeilo ei uhteigai sijaiþ fastan jah bidan þaþroþ þan samaþ gawandjaiþ ei ni fraisai izwara Satana in ungahobainais izwaraizos

text: But I speak this by permission , and not of commandment .
text2: þat uþ þan qiþa gakunnands ni bi haitjai

text: For I would that all men were even as I myself . But every man hath his proper gift of God , one after this manner , and another after that .
text2: iþ wiljau allans mans wisan swe mik silban akei ƕarjizuh swesa giba habaiþ fram guda sums swa sums uh swa

text: I say therefore to the unmarried and widows , It is good for them if they abide even as I .
text2: aþþan qiþa þaim unqenidam jah widuwom goþ ist im jabai sind swe ik

text: But if they cannot contain , let them marry : for it is better to marry than to burn .
text2: iþ jabai ni gahabaina sik liugandau batizo ist auk liugan þau intundnan

text: And unto the married I command , yet not I , but the Lord , Let not the wife depart from her husband :
text2: iþ þaim liugom haftam anabiuda ni ik ak frauja qenai fairra abin ni skaidan

text: But and if she depart , let her remain unmarried , or be reconciled to her husband : and let not the husband put away his wife .
text2: iþ jabai gaskaidnai wisan unliugaida aiþþau du abin seinamma aftra gagawairþjan jah aban qen ni fraletan

text: But to the rest speak I , not the Lord : If any brother hath a wife that believeth not , and she be pleased to dwell with him , let him not put her away .
text2: iþ þaim anþaraim ik qiþa ni frauja jabai ƕas broþar qen aigi ungalaubjandein jah so gawilja ist bauan miþ imma ni afletai þo qen

text: And the woman which hath an husband that believeth not , and if he be pleased to dwell with her , let her not leave him .
text2: jah qens soei aigi aban ungalaubjandan jah sa gawilja ist bauan miþ izai ni afletai þana aban

text: For the unbelieving husband is sanctified by the wife , and the unbelieving wife is sanctified by the husband : else were your children unclean ; but now are they holy .
text2: weihaida ist qens so ungalaubjandei in abin jah gaweihaids ist aba sa ungalaubjands in qenai aiþþau barna izwara unhrainja weseina iþ nu weiha sind

text: But if the unbelieving depart , let him depart . A brother or a sister is not under bondage in such cases : but God hath called us to peace .

text: For what knowest thou , O wife , whether thou shalt save thy husband ? or how knowest thou , O man , whether thou shalt save thy wife ?
text2: ƕa nuk kannt þu qino ei aban ganasjais aiþþau ƕa kannt guma þatei qen þeina ganasjais

text: But as God hath distributed to every man , as the Lord hath called every one , so let him walk . And so ordain I in all churches .

text: Let every man abide in the same calling wherein he was called .
